instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> T2 Issue no revive or restore
threads.message:
Hello, I have a MacBook pro motherboard that is not turning on, this had the battery previously replaced.
I have tried the following:
Plugged in the charger is showing 5v 0.03amps when I go into the dfu mode is showing 20v 0.03 to 0.07, sometimes goes to 0.38amp.
After I try to revive it, is not show anything on the screen and in Apple configurator is telling me that the apple configurator is not booted. Same if I try to restore.

Any help would be great.
Thanks

threads.title: Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> T2 Issue no revive or restore
threads.message:
Be sure to use original 96W charger; with corresponding 100W certified cable.

Do you get all G3S and SSD voltages?

threads.title: Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> T2 Issue no revive or restore
threads.message:
Hello, I actually have 87W charger, I will try today with 96W as well and reply back, thanks
The voltages looked ok but I will also double check again.

threads.title: Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> T2 Issue no revive or restore
threads.message: Hi‚Äô.it is as 2informaticos says very important to use the right charger. I do not have much hair but almost lost the rest of it because of a similar issue as yours.
